metadata.title: CVE-2022-48650 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:qla2xxx: Fix memory leak in __qlt_24xx_handle_abts() Commit 8f394da36a36("scsi: qla2xxx: Drop TARGET_SCF_LOOKUP_LUN_FROM_TAG") made the__qlt_24xx_handle_abts() function return early iftcm_qla2xxx_find_cmd_by_tag() didn't find a command, but it missed to cleanup the allocated memory for the management command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
